channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: For nearly three weeks, hundreds of Ukrainians hid from Russian bombs and missiles in the Mariupol theater. The miracle was how they cared for one another. https://t.co/W81cER5XMN

A federal judge struck down parts of a sweeping Florida elections law passed last year by the Republican-led state legislature, saying certain measures were unconstitutional and targeted Black voters https://t.co/ya68oqj5yp
Americans will be able to select an X gender designation on their passport applications starting April 11 https://t.co/Q5mebGQWJZ

Americans will be able to select an X gender designation on their passports starting next month, the State Department said, a new option for those who don’t identify as exclusively male or female https://t.co/LRUAPNIgrg

The tiny Persian Gulf kingdom of Qatar is emerging as one of Europe’s best hopes for weaning itself off Russian natural gas, in another sign of how the war in Ukraine is changing the world’s energy relationships https://t.co/n9vVA3RGnZ

Many patients have died in recent days at a large Shanghai elderly-care hospital that is battling a Covid-19 outbreak, a sign that a new wave of infections is hitting China’s financial capital harder than authorities have publicly disclosed https://t.co/DCTRZhIPvb
Scientists say they’ve created the first complete map of a human genetic code. It could help us learn more about human evolution and genetic diseases. https://t.co/ZjV2tDrj5v
Ukrainian factories keep running despite materials shortages and dangers. “If we work we help our land and we help our country.” https://t.co/cgaGpPjEOg
President Biden is expected to tap up to 180 million barrels of government oil reserves over the next six months to address rising energy prices, the White House said https://t.co/bhh6Lw8zLl
Two senior British judges resigned their posts on Hong Kong’s highest court, citing deteriorating freedoms in the city under a Beijing-imposed security law https://t.co/eQhkxIqFdn

NATO members outside the U.S. are set to boost their military spending following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, according to alliance Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg and pledges from member countries https://t.co/g84QgxxMwk

From @WSJopinion: I do not see how the U.S. and its allies can resume normal relations with Russia while Putin’s army enforces a de facto partition of Ukraine, writes @BillGalston. Putin cannot be rewarded for naked aggression. https://t.co/MNyfQWszLS

The Hubble telescope snapped an image showing the most distant individual star ever seen. Dubbed Earendel, the star lies 12.9 billion light-years from Earth and is believed to be about 50 times as massive as the sun. https://t.co/U93J8xfADB

Ukrainian officials said their armed forces are pressing forward against Russian military units around Kyiv, seeking to exploit Moscow’s efforts to regroup after weeks of heavy losses https://t.co/S1MhD2enJ4

Alisher Usmanov is one of Russia’s wealthiest oligarchs and has been sanctioned by the U.S. So why did a shipment of pig iron from one of his companies steam into Alabama early this month? https://t.co/RmzBpAZBwK

Bruce Willis is stepping away from his acting career after being diagnosed with aphasia, a condition that can affect the ability to speak or write, his family said Wednesday. Here’s what to know about the language disorder. https://t.co/6uMv3AKPvZ

“If I’m an American executive still inside of Russia, I would have left yesterday,” a former State Department counterterrorism chief said, as officials warned that Russian authorities have “singled out” U.S. citizens in Russia for harassment https://t.co/ZG5YTrQANY

President Biden is preparing to announce the release of up to 1 million barrels of oil a day from the U.S. strategic petroleum reserve, according to people familiar with the plans https://t.co/qc4qlcR9Pf

The Academy said it asked Will Smith to leave the Oscars after he slapped Chris Rock, and the actor refused. The organization has initiated disciplinary proceedings against Smith that could include suspension, expulsion or other sanctions. https://t.co/fEJelOW5MN

“How was your weekend?” Chris Rock asked fans at his first stand-up show since being slapped by Will Smith at the Oscars, acknowledging the incident only briefly during his set https://t.co/fumRKAQIri

Bruce Willis is stepping away from his acting career after being diagnosed with aphasia, a condition that can affect the ability to speak or write, his family said Wednesday. Here’s what to know about the language disorder. https://t.co/TFDXnid7XD

From @WSJopinion: We trust judges to behave professionally and with integrity when it comes to recusal decisions, and Justice Clarence Thomas has earned our trust, writes @jasonrileywsj https://t.co/fNkKLk5gfZ

Breaking: The Academy said it asked Will Smith to leave the Oscars after he slapped Chris Rock, and the actor refused. The organization has initiated disciplinary proceedings against Smith that could include suspension, expulsion or other sanctions. https://t.co/ncazweHPzr

Most Russian forces around Kyiv haven’t shifted away from the Ukrainian capital despite Moscow’s pledge to limit its operations there, according to a Pentagon assessment of the situation on the ground in Ukraine https://t.co/8l7La8JZ0a v

U.S. Trade Representative Katherine Tai said the U.S. must shift the focus of its trade policy to rebuilding its domestic manufacturing industries, and lessening ties to unfriendly economies https://t.co/ajUrKjPmB7

Far-right radio host Alex Jones was ordered to appear for a deposition in the defamation case filed against him by families of victims of the Sandy Hook school shooting or face weekly fines starting at $25,000 after a judge found him in contempt of court https://t.co/hjwPf34OH4

The U.S. plans to end a Trump-era pandemic policy that allows it to immediately turn away migrants at the southern border, according to a draft of the order, which the CDC plans to issue later this week https://t.co/0c5hz8dpMe

Bruce Willis is stepping away from his acting career after being diagnosed with aphasia—a condition that can affect cognitive function, including the ability to speak or write—his family said https://t.co/5Sz5GRVfdE

President Vladimir Putin’s approval rating in Russia has soared since he launched his invasion of Ukraine—to 83% from 71%—according to an independent Russian pollster. Experts have cautioned against taking current Russian polls on face value. https://t.co/5O3oscfpZg

A NASA astronaut is slated Wednesday to return to Earth from the International Space Station on a Russian vehicle, as U.S. and Russian space agencies continue to carry out operations at the facility following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/URjbMyBEUC

The Hubble telescope snapped an image showing the most distant individual star ever seen. Dubbed Earendel, the star lies 12.9 billion light-years from Earth and is believed to be about 50 times as massive as the sun. https://t.co/yh8JwyFrMP

EU countries aiming to tighten sanctions on Russia are considering targeting more banks and oligarchs’ relatives, as well as strengthening cryptocurrency restrictions, according to diplomats and officials https://t.co/Ru6Oz319T7

The Kremlin on Wednesday dashed hopes that the most recent round of peace talks between Russia and Ukraine would end fighting soon, signaling attacks that have caused devastation across Ukraine would continue https://t.co/DUb4STGPzi
A New York judge ruled Monday that the Trump Organization must hand over outstanding materials that state Attorney General Letitia James subpoenaed https://t.co/lvcPeW9Mrw
The streets of Shanghai are mostly deserted as China’s most populous city tries to contain an outbreak of Covid-19 with a new lockdown #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/zaF5ZRorzW https://t.co/uCuCECI1IQ

When Will Smith retaliated for a joke by slapping Chris Rock, comedians saw the incident from two angles: as a rich source of material for themselves, and as an assault on one of their own. "As Rock got hit, I got hit. We comedians, we felt the pain." https://t.co/4YvcNoc58x
GOP Sen. Susan Collins will vote to confirm Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson for the Supreme Court, the first Republican senator to endorse the nominee https://t.co/1ksGmhmOvL
From @WSJopinion: Biden pivots left again, with a 20% tax on unrealized asset gains. A tax increase of this magnitude is never desirable, but the timing now is especially bad. https://t.co/oBTgZsaQB7
A gunman opened fire in a small town on the outskirts of Tel Aviv, killing four people in the third suspected terrorist attack in Israel in a week https://t.co/sVNbRr6WRl
From @WSJopinion: Putin wanted a weaker Europe, increasingly separated from the U.S. It looks as if he’s going to get exactly the opposite, writes @wrmead https://t.co/37nwZJCRhd
Weeks after suffering symptoms of suspected poisoning, Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich played a high-profile role Tuesday in Russian-Ukrainian peace talks in Istanbul https://t.co/LPOVSgVDYX

Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is leading Taiwan to rethink how it would defend itself in the event of an invasion by China, stirring new debates over weapons, military tactics and even whether to extend military conscription https://t.co/iXgoGASDDN
Positive drug tests among U.S. workers hit a two-decade high last year, new data show, as businesses grappled with nationwide labor shortages https://t.co/GKTXDHiV2q
Four European countries said Tuesday they were kicking out more than 40 Russian officials over national-security threats, citing spying and influence operations as reasons https://t.co/i8koOsG12s
From @WSJopinion: Is it any wonder that much of America has lost all respect for self-referential Hollywood? https://t.co/0V4srM8wMn
Robinhood Markets said it is extending the hours it will let its users trade to between 7 a.m. ET and 8 p.m. ET https://t.co/nwi0NxyG5d

President Biden said the U.S. and its European allies were waiting to see if Russia was sincere in cease-fire talks with Ukraine but had no intention of lifting sanctions against Moscow at this stage https://t.co/q0yf6bq3lm

Johnson & Johnson said it has suspended sales of its personal-care products in Russia, though it will continue to sell medicine and medical devices there, in the wake of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/QjW6sGMG8A

Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is leading Taiwan to rethink how it would defend itself in the event of an invasion by China, stirring new debates over weapons, military tactics and even whether to extend military conscription https://t.co/TzesGZflEi
Russia's eight-year effort to build a homegrown alternative to Visa and Mastercard paid off when the U.S. card giants left the country https://t.co/XYv5iW7euz
